paper.title: The complete convergence of best fit decreasing
paper.publisher: Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics
paper.abstract: Consider a probability measure $\mu $ on $[0,1]$ and an independent sequence of random variables $X_1 , \cdots ,X_n , \cdots $ distributed according to $\mu $. No regularity assumptions are made on $\mu $. Denote by $B(X_1 , \cdots ,X_n )$ the number of unit-size bins that are used by Best Fit Decreasing to pack items of size $X_1 , \cdots ,X_n $. The existence of a constant $b(\mu )$ is proven such that for each $\varepsilon u003e 0,$\[ \sum\limits_{n \geqq 1} {P( \left|n^{ - 1} B \left(X_1 , \cdots X_n \right) - b(\mu ) \right| \geqq \varepsilon )} u003c \infty . \]
